text: Xrôshtag and Padvâxtag are two deities in Manichaean religion. They are always shown together and represent the concepts of "call" and "answer."Burkitt, F. C. 1935. Xrôshtag and Padvâxtag, Call and Answer. JTS 36:180–181. The call comes from the "living spirit" above, and the answer comes from the person below who wants to be saved. * == References == Category:Manichaeism
title: Xroshtag and Padvaxtag
